meanings.definition: To immerse again in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: After washing the dishes, she reimmersed the cup in soapy water to ensure it was clean.
meanings.sent2: He reimmersed the cloth in the dye to make the color darker.
meanings.sent3: The curious toddler reimmersed his toy car in the bathtub, pretending it was driving through a deep river.
meanings.sent4: She reimmersed herself in the world of painting, losing track of time as she blended colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The chef reimmersed the vegetables in the boiling water, intensifying the flavors of the soup.

meanings.definition: To involve oneself deeply in a particular activity or situation once more.
meanings.sent1: After taking a break, she reimmersed herself in the challenging puzzle, determined to solve it.
meanings.sent2: He reimmersed himself in the study of ancient history, eager to learn more about past civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The bookworm reimmersed himself in the fantasy novel, getting lost in the magical world of dragons and wizards.
meanings.sent4: She reimmersed herself in the music, feeling the rhythm and melody resonate within her soul.
meanings.sent5: The explorer reimmersed himself in the jungle, navigating through the dense foliage with a sense of adventure.
